item.title: Google’s AI search summaries are rolling out to over 100 more countries
item.description:
Google’s AI Overviews are expanding across more than 100 countries this week. The AI-generated search summaries will appear for users in Canada, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, Colombia, Chile, the Phillippines, Nigeria, and many more locations. You can view the full list of countries on Google’s website.

In each country, AI Overviews will now appear in any supported language, including English, Hindi, Indonesian, Japanese, Portuguese, and Spanish. That means if you’re located in the US, you can make a search in Spanish and see an AI Overview in the same language.

Earlier this month, Google rolled out ads in AI Overviews on mobile — but only in the US. For all other locations, Google says “ads will continue to appear in dedicated...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Emma Roth

item.title: Google now sells ‘like-new’ refurbished Pixel 6 and 7 phones
item.description:
Google now sells refurbished Pixel 6, Pixel 6A, and Pixel 7 phones in a special section of the Google Store. The company says that these phones will be of like-new quality with phones, screens, and batteries that technicians “carefully inspect” and are offered at up to a 40 percent discount versus their original price. The phones also come with the same 1-year limited warranty and customer support options as a new phone.

Here’s the price breakdown:

  • Pixel 6 — $339 (originally $599)
  • Pixel 6 Pro — $539 (originally $899)
  • Pixel 6A — $249 (originally $449)
  • Pixel 7 — $429 (originally $599)
  • Pixel 7 Pro — $629 (originally $899)

While those prices cover 128GB models, Google spokesperson Patrick Seybold told The Verge via email that its...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Wes Davis

item.title: A mysterious new image generation model has appeared
item.description:
A mysterious new image generation model is beating models from Midjourney, Black Forest Labs, and OpenAI on the crowdsourced Artificial Analysis benchmark. The model, which goes by the name “red_panda,” is around 40 Elo points ahead of the next-best-ranking model, Black Forest Labs’ Flux1.1 Pro, on Artificial Analysis’ text-to-image leaderboard. Artificial Analysis uses Elo, a […]

item.title: Apple Intelligence is coming to the EU in April 2025
item.description:
Remember when Apple blamed EU tech rules — and more specifically the Digital Markets Act — to justify the fact that Apple Intelligence wouldn’t be available in the European Union? Maybe that was just an attempt to turn EU users against their regulators as Apple Intelligence is coming to the EU in April 2025 along […]

item.title: Apple updates iMac with M4 Chip, 16GB RAM starting at $1,299
item.description:
Apple kicked off “Mac week” by unveiling a refresh to its perennial favorite all-in-one, the iMac. The big news here is the addition of the newish M4 chip, which the company says is 2x more powerful than the original M1 iMac. The new desktop notably arrives alongside the general availability of Apple Intelligence, which debuts […]

item.title: Apple Intelligence goes live with iOS 18.1 update
item.description:
Apple on Monday confirmed the general availability of iOS 18.1, iPadOS 18.1, and macOS Sequoia 15.1. The point update is most notable for its inclusion of the first batch of Apple Intelligence features, which the company announced at WWDC back in June. However, only select Apple devices are equipped to run the new generative AI […]
